page.title: 13PORTESSIE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: ORIGINALLY, THE SCHOOL FOR THE PEOPLE OF THE AREA WAS IN THE COUNTRY, PROBABLY THE CENTRE OF THE POPULATION. THE PRESENT SCHOOL WAS BUILT AROUND 1940. IT WAS ORIGINALLY A SECONDARY AND PRIMARY SCHOOL BUT WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATION IN THE 1960'S, THE SECONDARY DEPARTMENT CLOSED. THE PUPILS WENT TO BUCKIE HIGH SCHOOL. IN JUNE 1985, PORTESSIE SCHOOL HAS A ROLE OF 91 PUPILS BETWEEN THE AGES OF 5 AND 12. THERE IS THE HEAD TEACHER MISS A. MCARTHUR AND THREE TEACHERS MRS B. MACKIE, MISS W. REAICH AND MISS A. REID. MR A. CLARK HAS BEEN THE JANITOR FOR MORE THAN 25 YEARS. ALSO ON THE SCHOOL'S PERMANENT STAFF IS A SECRETARY, AN AUXILIARY, A DINING ROOM ATTENDANT AND TWO CLEANERS.
